Ditanya Dana Nasabah BTN Dibobol, Erick Thohir: Tunggu Dirut Baru
05 Nov 2019, 05:22 by vad


Menteri BUMN Erick Thohir (Foto: Grandyos Zafna/detikcom)

Jakarta - Kasus pembobolan dana nasabah Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN) yang menimpa PT Surya Artha Nusantara Finance (SAN Finance) kembali mencuat. Pasalnya, hingga kini BTN dikabarkan belum mengembalikan dana SAN Finance sebesar Rp 110 miliar yang bobol pada tahun 2016 itu.Lantas, bagaimana kelanjutan kasus tersebut?Menteri Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) Erick Thohir mengatakan, ia belum menerima laporan mengenai kasus tersebut. Ia akan menunggu hasil lapora dari Direktur Utama BTN yang baru nantinya."Belum (ada laporan). Nanti kita tunggu Dirut yang baru," ujar Erick usai menghadiri rapat koordinasi di kantor Kemenko Perekonomian, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Erick menuturkan, pihaknya telah mengantongi nama pengisi jabatan nomor satu di BTN, dan akan diumumkan di akhir bulan November."Akhir November. Jadinya akhir bulan. Karena masih dalam proses mereview juga, Dirutnya juga sudah ada," tutur Erick.Ia memastikan, baik pihaknya maupun BTN akan mengambil langkah-langkah hebat untuk mengelola bank pelat merah tersebut dengan baik, juga dalam menangani kasus yang menimpa SAN Finance ini."Ya pasti ada langkah-langkah hebat lah, tunggu saja," tandasnya.Sebagai informasi, dilansir dari CNBC Indonesia, dana SAN Finance yang dibobol sebesar Rp 110 miliar tersebut mencakup 44% dari total dana yang ditempatkan di BTN.Direktur SAN Finance Naga Sujady mengatakan perusahaan memasukkan dana senilai total Rp 250 miliar pada 2016 dalam bentuk giro. Saat terjadi pembobolan dana nasabah di bank tersebut, dana milik SAN Finance tersisa Rp 140 miliar dan langsung ditarik semuanya, sementara sisanya masih belum dikembalikan oleh pihak bank."Kami menempatkan dana di BTN dengan rekening yang sama, sekarang baru kembali Rp 140 miliar, sisanya belum. Kalau Rp 140 miliar bisa kembali kok Rp 110 ga bisa," kata Naga di Menara FIF, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Dia menegaskan, jika dihitung sejak 2016 dan waktu terkini total dana Rp 110 miliar tersebut sudah mencapai Rp 160 miliar. Termasuk di dalamnya sebesar Rp 45 miliar yang immaterial dan sisanya merupakan bunga yang seharusnya diterima oleh perusahaan.Hingga saat ini perusahaan sudah melakukan beberapa langkah hukum. Paling baru, pihak perusahaan sudah melakukan pengajuan peninjauan kembali (PK) ke PN Jakarta Pusat pada 3 Oktober 2019 atas kasus tersebut. Asked about BTN Customer Funds Breaked, Erick Thohir: Wait for the New President Director
05 Nov 2019, 05:22 by vad


BUMN Minister Erick Thohir (Photo: Grandyos Zafna / detikcom)

Jakarta - The Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN) customer burglary case that struck PT Surya Artha Nusantara Finance (SAN Finance) has re-emerged. The reason is, until now BTN has reportedly not returned SAN Finance funds amounting to Rp 110 billion, which was broken in 2016. Then, how will the case continue? Minister of State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) Erick Thohir said he had not yet received a report regarding the case. He will wait for the results of the report from the new BTN President Director. "Not yet (there are reports). We will wait for the new CEO," said Erick after attending a coordination meeting at the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). Erick said, his side had pocketed the number one position filler at BTN, and it would be announced at the end of November. "End of November. So it will be at the end of the month. His party and BTN will take great steps to manage the state-owned bank well, also in handling the case of SAN Finance. "Yes, there must be great steps, just wait," he said. As information, as reported by CNBC Indonesia, SAN Finance funds which were burglarized in the amount of Rp 110 billion included 44% of the total funds placed in BTN. SAN Finance Director Naga Sujady said the company put in funds totaling Rp 250 billion in 2016 in the form of demand deposits. When there was a break-in of customer funds at the bank, SAN Finance's remaining funds amounted to Rp 140 billion and all of them were withdrawn immediately, while the rest was still not returned by the bank. "We placed the funds in BTN with the same account. not yet. If Rp 140 billion can return, how come Rp 110 cannot, "said Naga at the FIF Tower, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019). He stressed, if calculated since 2016 and the current time the total funds of Rp 110 billion have already reached Rp 160 billion. This includes Rp. 45 billion which is immaterial and the rest is interest that should be received by the company. Until now the company has taken several legal steps.
